content:
• Friday, June 12, 2015

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MYGN +4.0%. VIRC +2.3%. ARAY +1.1%. CSIQ +1.1%. CDTX +1.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ZU -3.3%. OTC:ANTH -1.8%. DWA -1.5%. RBCN -1.4%.TOUR -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GAZ +13.04%. UNG +6.69%. VNM +3.18%. EWS +2.22%. OIL +1.99%.
    • Losers: VXX -4.45%. EPI -2.18%. URA -2.11%. KOL -2.08%. FCG -2.02%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy increases projected Q2 revenue decline

    • Basic Energy Services (BAS +2.4%) is higher despite increasing its projected Q2 revenue decline to 22%-24% Q/Q compared with prior expectations for a 10%-15% drop, due mostly to adverse weather earlier in the quarter.
    • BAS says its well servicing rig count remains unchanged at 421, with May well servicing rig hours at 48.2K, producing a rig utilization rate of 50% vs. 50% in the prior month and 70% in May 2014.
    • Says price concessions are starting to stabilize in most operating markets, and well servicing and fluid services utilization appears to have reached steady levels with potential for slight improvement through the summer months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras "time bomb" could hit Paragon Offshore, Diamond Offshore, Ensco

    • Petrobras (PBR -0.2%) will soon release its strategic business plan, and Cowen analysts believe Paragon Offshore (PGN +1.2%), Diamond Offshore (DO -1.6%) and Ensco (ESV -1.5%) could be at risk, while Noble Corp.'s (NE -1.2%) exposure looks manageable.
    • PBR has been cutting rig activity to 50 operated rigs from 70 since mid-2013, including the unilateral cancellation of contracts on five floaters leased from Brazilian drilling contractor Schahin just last month; the cuts will drive what Cowen predicts will be a 30% decline in spending outlined in PBR's strategic business plan update to $150B-$160B for 2015-19 from the $220B in the current 2014-18 business plan.
    • With PBR aggressively cutting rigs wherever it can, the firm thinks PGN, DO and ESV are at risk with ~25%, 20% and 15% of their respective backlogs tied to the PBR; less than 5% of NE's backlog is tied to the Brazilian company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 17 Comments
  • KFY

    Korn/Ferry in high cotton as hiring picks up

    • The company last night reported adjusted FQ4 EPS of $0.51 per share vs. $0.43 one year ago, with EBITDA of $40.7M vs. $34.5M, and EBITDA margin of 15% vs. 13.7%.
    • Executive recruitment fee revenue rose 12.1% Y/Y on a constant currency basis. Leadership & Talent Consulting revenue grew 14.5% on a constant currency basis.
    • The major headwind at this point looks to be the strong dollar, with the company expecting FQ1 EPS of $0.44-$0.50.
    • More good omens: Bloomberg's Nicole Sinclair notes North American executive search levels rose 10% from a year year ago, with financial services up 17%. The company also had more "upticks" than usual, meaning payouts to individuals were at higher-than-anticipated levels for the position.
    • KFY +2.15% on the session, and up nearly 50% over the last eight months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • BTU

    Coal shares sink amid worries over mine liability funding

    • Peabody Energy (BTU -8.1%) and Arch Coal (ACI -12.3%) plunge to all-time intraday lows amid concerns that they will have to pay more for insurance that covers environmental damage.
    • "Investors don’t know how to handicap this self-bonding issue,” says Doyle Trading CEO Ted O’Brien. "Until the companies come out and give Wall Street certainty that they know how to deal with it, I think we’re going to be stuck in this vortex."
    • Wyoming regulators have told Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -10.6%) that it no longer qualifies for a self-bonding program which allows coal producers to cheaply insure their clean-up costs in case of bankruptcy, and are reviewing financial data from BTU and ACI to see if they still qualify.
    • Two other coal miners, Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -6.7%) and Walter Energy (WLT -8.2%), also have sunk to record intraday lows.
    • ETF: KOL
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 37 Comments
  • CRTO

    Ad-techs settle down from Apple content-blocking OS news

    • Advertising technology companies have stabilized a bit today after slipping on yesterday's news that Apple's new operating system would support blocking of cookies and other content.
    • Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO) is up 0.2% after yesterday's 7.3% drop, and Rubicon Project (NYSE:RUBI) is down just 1.3% today, compared to yesterday's 4.7% decline. Rocket Fuel (NASDAQ:FUEL) is up 0.2%; TubeMogul (NASDAQ:TUBE) is off 1.3% after slipping into the close to finish -7.9% yesterday.
    • B. Riley's Sameet Sinha thinks Rubicon Project might actually benefit from the change (the impact of which Sinha figures is at least nine months out): It might actually drive more ad dollars toward key Rubicon inventory areas.
    • "One, it will drive ad dollars to App-based environments, such as AAPL’s iAds, where RUBI is the SSP," Sinha writes. "Two, it could drive ad dollars towards less blockable inventory, such as Native and Video, which are a growing segment of RUBI’s inventory
    • Sinha has a Buy on Rubicon Project with a $26 target; shares are trading today at $16.98.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMMR

    Immersion +3.8%; B. Riley thinks Apple license a matter of time

    • B. Riley's Mike Crawford, reiterating a Buy and $13 target on Immersion (NASDAQ:IMMR): "[W]e believe Apple, one of the last remaining handset OEMs not under license, will need a license from IMMR, although FY ’15 guidance and our estimates don’t include potential Apple license revenue."
    • He adds CEO Vic Viegas recently stated at a conference Immersion "intends to license Apple," and thinks Apple's value to Immersion would go well beyond license fees/royalties. "[W]e believe the company’s Content & Media division would also benefit if Apple incorporates haptics into its next generation iPhones, as the adoption and enablement of haptics by large mobile content providers (e.g. YouTube and Facebook) would likely accelerate as haptics technology in smartphones approaches ubiquity."
    • Apple has already integrated haptic Force Touch sensors into the Apple Watch and multiple MacBooks. The company is also expected to integrate Force Touch within next-gen iPhones.
    • Separately, at an event showing off the first commercial version of the Oculus Rift VR headset, Oculus revealed a pair of handheld motion controllers (known as Oculus Touch) that use haptics to provide feedback that matches a user's virtual world actions.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • AMBA

    Short-squeeze Friday: Ambarella up 7% on big volume

    • After taking a short breather this week in the wake of its post-earnings surge, Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) is off to the races again today, even as the Nasdaq drops 0.6%. 4.82M shares have been traded, far above a 3-month daily average of 1.88M.
    • Friday short-covering is likely a factor: 7.76M shares (28% of the float) were shorted as of May 30, and many of those shorts are undoubtedly staring at major paper losses.
    • The video processor/GoPro supplier is now up 135% YTD, and ~12x from where it traded in Feb. 2013. Shares go for 33x a (possibly conservative) FY17 (ends Jan. '17) EPS consensus of $3.65.
    • 4 days ago: Ambarella rises following Cramer plug
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • MTSI

    M/A-COM -4.2% following Drexel Hamilton downgrade

    • Drexel Hamilton has downgraded M/A-COM (NASDAQ:MTSI) to Hold.
    • The downgrade comes a day after the analog chipmaker made a new 52-week high of $42.02. Shares remain up 29% YTD, buoyed by a chip stock rally fueled in large part by an industry consolidation wave.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax up 6.7% a day after Oculus unveils consumer Rift model

    • Himax (NASDAQ:HIMX) is strongly adding to the Wednesday gains seen following a 2-notch BofA/Merrill upgrade. 5.23M shares have already been traded, well above a 3-month daily average of 2.62M.
    • Today's move comes a day after Facebook-owned Oculus showed off the first commercial version of its Rift VR headset; it goes on sale in Q1 2016. Oculus also announced a partnership with Microsoft to stream Xbox One games to the Rift (via Windows 10 PCs), and a pair of handheld motion controllers.
    • Himax supplies an LCD timing controller IC for Rift prototype models. There's no word yet on the component suppliers for the consumer Rift model, which contains two OLED panels (one for each eye).
    • Though the Rift doesn't sport an LCoS microdisplay, many Himax bulls have argued a big market opportunity exists for supplying microdisplays for VR and augmented reality headsets.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 20 Comments
  • SNSS

    Sunesis Pharma's vosaroxin shows 57% complete remission rate in late relapse leukemia patients; shares up 7%

    • Micro cap Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (SNSS +6.7%) heads north on a 9x surge in volume in response to its announcement of new data from a 711-subject Phase 3 study, called VALOR, evaluating its lead product candidate Qinprezo (vosaroxin) + the chemotherapeutic agent cytarabine versus placebo + cytarabine in adult patients with relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML). The data were presented at the 20th Congress of the European Hematology Association in Vienna, Austria.
    • The new results are from subgroups of patients at least 60 years old (n=451/711) categorized by late relapse (n=87) and refractory and early relapse (n=364).
    • In the late relapse group, overall survival (OS) and leukemia-free survival (LFS) were comparable between the two treatment arms. The complete remission (CR) rate and event-free survival (EFS) were higher in the vosaroxin arm (57% vs. 28% and 5.5 months vs. 2.3 months, respectively), but the latter was not statistically significant.
    • In the refractory and early relapse group, patients associated with poorer prognoses, OS and LFS comparisons in the two arms were 6.5 months vs. 3.9 months and 9.7 months vs. 5.5 months, respectively. The CR rate and EFS differences were 26% vs. 10% and 1.7 months vs. 1.3 months, respectively. All results were statistically significant.
    • The results from VALOR will support a New Drug Application (NDA).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum outlook enhanced by Hess midstream sale, analyst says

    • Whiting Petroleum (WLL -2.2%) is maintained with an Outperform rating at Oppenheimer, which believes the current sharp discount to peers reflects overblown liquidity concerns (Briefing.com).
    • Following yesterday's news that Hess will sell a 50% stake in its Bakken midstream assets for $2.675B, Oppenheimer says it remains confident that WLL will sell its own gas processing plants for a healthy valuation this year; the firm models $500M in net proceeds, or 10x estimated EBITDA of $50M, a steep discount to the 18x multiple that HES assets attracted.
    • While the firm maintains WLL can cut capex and grow production even without asset sales, it believe a transaction at or above its estimate would further narrow the valuation gap.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: WING +58%. OGEN +45%. ESI-OLD +23%. HGSH +21%. CSUN +18%. CFRX +13%. CCM +13%. XNET +11%. SUPN +11%.
    • Losers: CRBP -13%. MHR -11%. MARA -11%. RGSE -10%. RNO -10%. LOXO -10%. OCC -9%. STRM -9%. CRMD -8%. HNR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MOBI

    Chinese Internet stocks ignore market selloff, jump again

    • The Nasdaq is down 0.6% and the S&P 0.7%, but one wouldn't guess that from looking at the performance of U.S.-traded Chinese Web/mobile stocks (CQQQ +1.1%), which are continuing a torrid 2015.
    • Sky-mobi (MOBI +14.7%) and Xunlei (XNET +12.2%) top the list of major gainers. Others include YY (YY +4.8%), Vipshop (VIPS +4.6%), Cheetah Mobile (CMCM +6.7%), SouFun (SFUN +4.9%), Leju (LEJU +6.3%), iDreamSky (DSKY +6.4%), and Jumei (JMEI +4.1%).
    • Today's gains come after the Shanghai composite rose 0.9% overnight, and the Shenzhen index rose 1.3%. Bubble fears for Chinese exchanges are easy to find.
    • ETFs: KWEB, QQQC-OLD
    • Two days ago: Chinese Internet and solar stocks up strongly
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 10 Comments
  • DMDA

    Dex Media 2.1% lower as it sheds board member

    • Dex Media (DXM) is off 2.1% after disclosing in an 8-K that John Slater has resigned from its board of directors.
    • The company says the resignation "does not arise from any disagreement with the Company on any matter relating to the Company's operations, policies or practices."
    • Dex's board made recent news after refusing to accept resignations from two other directors, Thomas Gardner and Thomas Rogers, who lost re-election. Gardner is now named to all three of the board's committees, while Rogers will serve on the Compensation and Benefits Committee and the Corporate Governance Committee.
    • Dex Media won't fill Slater's vacancy, leaving the board at seven directors.
    • Amid some sales upheaval and the personnel moves this spring, Dex Media is down 10.2% this week, and down 87.4% over the past three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • AZZ

    AZZ downgraded to Neutral from Buy at DA Davidson

    • AZZ (AZZ -3.4%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $55 price target at DA Davidson, which says its thesis for the company has hinged primarily on a newer management team executing on operational initiatives, including improving profitability and refocusing efforts on previously ignored market opportunities.
    • The firm says it remains optimistic regarding management's plans and initiatives, but it is somewhat more cautious on broader industrial infrastructure end markets as owners recalibrate plans for near-term investment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital up 4.7% after adding $100M to buyback

    • InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) has rallied towards $59 after announcing (along with its quarterly dividend) it's adding $100M to its buyback authorization, raising its available funds to $179.8M.
    • InterDigital's buyback authorization is good for repurchasing over 8% of shares at current levels. The 3G/4G patent owner had $911M in cash at the end of Q1, and $473M in long-term debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell +4.5%; activist discloses stake, wants cost cuts

    • Vertex Capital has disclosed a 1.5M-share (5.1%) stake in Maxwell (NASDAQ:MXWL). The firm uses the disclosure to state it has "serious concerns with [Maxwell's] financial performance and implore the Board of [Maxwell] to establish a credible plan to better align costs with revenue in order to return the Issuer to profitability."
    • Vertex also declares it doesn't think Maxwell "should raise capital through a dilutive equity offering and should consider other means to improve [the company's] balance sheet while maximizing the value for all stockholders." The remarks come a day after the company announced it had finished raising $10M through a stock offering.
    • Shares are now up 14% over the last 3 days. They remain down 39% YTD, thanks in large part to the guidance provided in February and April.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 6 Comments
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold updates plans for Olympias Mine development

    • Eldorado Gold (EGO -2.5%) releases an update for the phased development of its 95%-owned Olympias Mine in Greece, which includes an $83M estimate for total capital spending for the concentrator upgrade and mine development for Phase II through 2015-2016.
    • RBC says the update indicates Olympias Phase II remains on track to start production in mid-2016, while the start of the Skouries project has been slightly delayed to Q1 2017 from late 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • OCN

    Moody's: Conservative numbers say Ocwen solvency no longer an issue

    • Some numbers: Ocwen Financial (OCN +3.7%) had (at Q1's end) a $1.2B senior secured bank term loan (SSTL), plus $350M of outstanding unsecured debt.
    • The company has signed LOIs or has already closed on sales of about $90B UPB in performing agency MSRs, roughly 23% of its loans serviced and subserviced as of the end of 2014. Ocwen also expects to sell a portion of its MSRs on non-performing agency loans. It expects to complete most of the MSR sales by year-end.
    • Assuming the money is not invested in new businesses (and 75% of it has to go to SSTL repayment), Moody's estimates Ocwen's cash balance will grow to $642M by year-end (from $242M at end of Q1), and the SSTL balance will fall to $605M. For its part, Ocwen has said it will pay down the SSTL even faster and sees the balance at less than $450M at year-end. Earlier this week, Ocwen said a recent payment had brought the SSTL balance down to $939.4M.
    • As for the $350M in unsecured debt, should Ocwen decide to finance its unencumbered servicer advances, it will also have enough cash to fully pay that balance down by the end of the year.
    • So far, it's great for the creditors, but what about stockholders? Regulatory scrutiny continues, and the company remains - likely until at least late this year - unable to acquire new MSRs.
    • The company's fledgling origination business could be a source of organic growth, says Moody's, but success in that line is easier said than done. Ocwen is the owner of Homeward Residential, which it acquired from Wilbur Ross three years ago.
    • Previously: Ocwen Financial pays down some debt (June 10)
    • Previously: Ocwen slides as S&P sets up for possible downgrade (June 5)
    • Previously: Ocwen Financial gets upgrade from Moody's (June 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz on the move after Jana invests in United Rentals

    • Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) is up 1.45% after Jana Partners takes a stake in United Rentals.
    • Joe Kunkle notes Jana holds a sizable position in Hertz and pushed management at the company in the past to consider a merger with United Rentals.
    • Previously: United Rentals higher after Jana takes stake
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • DLR

    Digital Realty up 1.7% as Cowen, Canaccord add upgrades

    • Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR) is up another 1.7% today as REITWeek brings more analyst upgrades, from Cowen & Co. and Canaccord Genuity.
    • Earlier, Macquarie had upgraded the stock and raised its price target.
    • Cowen & Co. upgraded it to Outperform from Neutral, and raised its price target to $73 from $70. Colby Synesael points to conversations with management showing "major transformation is starting to take shape that should result in a more dynamic/higher growth company that in our view is deserving of a higher multiple."
    • "M&A also appears likely albeit not necessarily imminent and would accelerate this transformation," Synesael adds.
    • Canaccord upgraded the stock to Buy, from Hold, and raised its price target to $77 from $72.
    • DLR is trading today at $66.33.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators spikes off unlikely Home Depot rumors

    • Shares of Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) are up 6.65% on some vague market rumors that home improvement giant Home Depot is interested in acquiring the embattled flooring seller.
    • Home Depot is trading in-line with market averages as investors ignore the speculation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 8 Comments

  • Treasurys continue surge as money flows out of periphery

    • Topping 2.50% about 24 hours ago, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield has slipped to 2.33% as traders sell the debt of EU periphery states like Spain and Italy, and move money into Germany and the U.S.
    • The German 10-year Bund yield is at 0.84% after topping 1% early yesterday.
    • At work is worry over Greece after the IMF team left Brussels and returned to D.C. yesterday without a deal. The bond bear market of the last few weeks was notable for hitting the U.S. and Germany harder than the periphery, but if Greece defaults or Grexits, Spain and Italy could be next in line.
    • TLT +0.8%, TBT -1.6%.
    • Previously: EU periphery bond yields shoot higher; European stocks head south (June 12)
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, IEF, TBF, EDV, TMF, PST, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, IEI, TYO, UBT, DLBS, DTYS, UST, TLO, VGIT, TBX, SCHR, TENZ, GSY, TYD, LBND, ITE, DTYL, DLBL, TYBS, DFVL, FIVZ, VUSTX, TBZ, DFVS, TYNS, SYTL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 6 Comments
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings jumps on Wingstop IPO day

    • Shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) show no fear of an IPO by Wingstop creating more competition in the chicken wing space through a faster pace of expansion for the chain.
    • BWLD is +2.1% on strong volume.
    • Previously: Smashing IPO open for Wingstop
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • WING

    Smashing IPO open for Wingstop

    • Wingstop (NASDAQ:WING) opens trading up 65.8% to $31.50.
    • Shares of the restaurant chain are more than double where they were originally priced.
    • The smashing opening continues a strong trend for restaurant IPOs.
    • Previously: What to like about the Wingstop IPO (May. 10 2015)
    • Previously: Huge returns for early restaurant IPO investors (Jun. 10 2015)
    • Previously: Wingstop IPO priced above expected range (Jun. 12 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 19 Comments
  • MFIN

    TAXI slumps as chunk of medallions could hit the market

    • It was raining hard in Frisco ... A Manhattan judge has ordered the "Taxi King" of NYC to give up nearly 90 of his taxi medallion stash of 900 in order to satisfy $31.5M of past-due loans owed to Citibank.
    • Citi plans to sell the medallions - once worth more than $1M each, but now fetching about $700K, in part thanks to Uber.
    • The Taxi King (Gene Freidman) is expected to appeal the decision today, but if the appeal fails, medallion prices face a further drop as the extra supply hits the market, says market-watcher Brian Horey, warning a of "cascade of foreclosures."
    • Source: NYPost
    • Medallion Financial (TAXI -2%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 17 Comments
  • ORAN

    Apologetic Orange chief Richard meets with Netanyahu

    • Orange (ORAN -2.3%) CEO Stephane Richard met with Israeli premier Benjamin Netanyahu today to apologize for remarks in Cairo last week about exiting Israel, and said that Orange doesn't take part in boycotts.
    • On June 3, Richard said "I am ready to abandon [the Israel relationship] tomorrow morning" except for worries about "really sizable" penalties. Orange wireless services are resold in Israel through Partner Communications (PTNR +0.9%). Richard later said his issues with regard to the Partner relationship were business and not political.
    • In March, Partner renewed its contract to use Orange's brand for 10 more years.
    • Even after apologizing, Richard has issued conflicting statements about his intentions to continue the arrangement with Partner. Today he said that Orange has been active in Israel for 20 years and intends to continue to develop its companies there, which include Orange Business Services and Internet TV specialist Viaccess-Orca.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling +5% as Bloomberg highlights as potential takeover target

    • The year-long oil price rout has depressed Pacific Drilling’s (PACD +4.9%) market value by nearly two-thirds, making it an attractive takeover target for operators looking to strengthen their presence in ultra-deepwater drilling, Bloomberg writes.
    • PACD already has garnered interest from larger rivals such as Ensco (ESV -1.2%), Transocean (RIG -2.8%) and Seadrill (SDRL -1.9%) in the last 12-18 months, with one of the approaches coming as recently as this year, according to the report.
    • PACD is not believed to be actively exploring a sale, but the shares are trading well below replacement value for the rigs that they own, Evercore analyst James West points out.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 28 Comments
  • CTXS

    Upgrades arrive for Citrix following Elliott's letter; shares +3.1%

    • BofA/Merrill and Needham have upgraded Citrix (NASDAQ:CTXS) to Buy a day after Elliott Management disclosed a 7.1% stake and called for big changes, and Piper has upgraded to Neutral. Shares are now up 10% from Wednesday's close.
    • BofA's Kash Rangan ($82 target) argues asset sales/spinoffs could unlock considerable value."If CTXS were to spin out or divest Networking and SaaS businesses and focus on the core Workspace/Virtualization business, we believe that the three separate businesses could actually grow faster and achieve higher margins individually. We estimate a ~$94 valuation under this scenario."
    • Piper's Katherine Egbert assigns a $66-$81 breakup value, and a ~$92 buyout value. She thinks a spinoff of Citrix's enterprise mobility apps unit - Citrix has been investing heavily in the business - would be accretive. Stifel's Brad Reback (Buy, $95 target) also argues a mobility spinoff could unlock value.
    • Much like many other companies put in the same situation, Citrix has responded to Elliott's letter with a brief statement declaring it welcomes shareholder input and "continually [evaluates] ideas to drive shareholder value."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan opens nearly 2% lower after cautious Barron's piece

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI -1.8%) opens lower, perhaps in response to a new bearish thesis on the company from Valuentum Securities president Brian Nelson, who outlines five reasons why KMI shares will "collapse."
    • Like some previous negative commentary, Nelson questions the solidity of KMI's underlying earnings, but he also argues that the company’s debt load “is downright scary."
    • Nelson writes that KMI's debt (net of cash) was $42.8B in Q1 vs. $40.6B in the year-ago quarter, and the debt-to-EBITDA ratio was 5.8x vs. 5.5x in last year’s quarter; he adds that KMI is “not generating organic free operating cash flow, and it had just $315M in cash on the balance sheet at last check."
    • "We’re going to see something really bad happen to Kinder Morgan shareholders very soon... We’re not sticking around to find out how bad," Nelson writes.
    • The piece first appeared yesterday on Yahoo Finance but was referenced in a Barron's column published last night.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 79 Comments
  • BONA

    Founder, chairman launches go-private offer for Bona Film Group

    • China's Bona Film Group (NASDAQ:BONA) has acknowledged receiving a non-binding go-private proposal from its founder and chairman, Yu Dong, along with his buyer group, for $13.70/ADS. That's around a 23.6% premium over the 30-day average closing price.
    • The firm's ADS jumped in the last half-hour of U.S. trading yesterday to finish up 5.6% to $12.86. Shares are halted on Nasdaq.
    • The board is forming a committee of independent directors to look at the offer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 5 Comments
  • NBGGY

    EU periphery bond yields shoot higher; European stocks head south

    • The bond rout of the past few weeks has been notable for its correlation. The bond markets of putative solid credits like Germany and the U.S. were hit as hard or even harder than those of countries like Spain and Italy.
    • Potentially worrisome in today's action: Yields are flat to lower in Germany and the U.S. while moving sharply higher in the peripheral countries.
    • The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield is down 1 bp to 2.37% and the 10-year German Bund yield is lower by 3 bps to 0.86%. Meanwhile, the Spanish 10-year yield is up 18 bps to 2.31%, and Italy up 12 bps to 2.26%.
    • This is happening as another Greek default and then possible EU exit got more likely with the IMF technical team's return to D.C. yesterday, and investors may not want to be holding the paper of the next countries in line should anything adverse happen over the weekend.
    • Spain's IBEX 35 (NYSEARCA:EWP) is lower by 1.3%, and Italy's FTSE MIB (NYSEARCA:EWI) by 1.5%. Elsewhere in Europe, Germany (NYSEARCA:EWG) is down 1.5% and France (NYSEARCA:EWQ) is down 1.7%. FEZ -2.2%, GREK -4.1%, NBG -7%
    • ETFs: VGK, FEZ, HEDJ, IEV, EU, EPV, EZU, FEU, EEA, EURL, FEP, UPV, DBEU, BUNL, ADRU, HEZU, FEEU, IEUR, BUNT, GGOV, FIEU, DBEZ, FEUZ, SBEU
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • KUTV

    Ku6 Media down 7.9% as Q1 revenues slide

    • Ku6 Media (NASDAQ:KUTV) is off 7.9% in early action after posting fiscal Q1 results with a narrower net loss on revenues that fell off 32% sequentially and 16% Y/Y.
    • The firm had a gross profit for the second straight quarter, and net loss swelled to $0.83M from Q4's loss of $0.04M. The loss was lower than the previous year's $4.41M loss, and cost of revenues fell 48%.
    • The firm notes "substantial doubt" around its ability to continue as a going concern. Cash and equivalents were $7.4M at quarter's end.
    • Its largest shareholder, Xudong Xu, entered into a share resale agreement in which about 40.7% of share capital was sold to Shanda Media to repay a promissory note. Earlier this spring, Xu agreed to provide a $4.84M one-year loan to Ku6.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM

    Keurig Green Mountain slumps after UBS loses faith
